body_html:
I've submitted a PR to the Eigen repo containing a simple single-threaded implementation of a TensorScanOp, which has just been merged.
Ideally I'd like to extend this with thread-based and a CUDA implementations using an approach like in the article that @chemelnucfin quoted above.
Let's see if I'll have enough time to do it.
Failing that, I think that adding TensorFlow ops that use the naive implementation would still be useful.
body_text:
I've submitted a PR to the Eigen repo containing a simple single-threaded implementation of a TensorScanOp, which has just been merged.
Ideally I'd like to extend this with thread-based and a CUDA implementations using an approach like in the article that @chemelnucfin quoted above.
Let's see if I'll have enough time to do it.
Failing that, I think that adding TensorFlow ops that use the naive implementation would still be useful.
body:
I've submitted a [PR to the Eigen repo](https://bitbucket.org/eigen/eigen/pull-requests/189/add-scan-op-to-tensor-module) containing a simple single-threaded implementation of a `TensorScanOp`, which has just been merged.
Ideally I'd like to extend this with thread-based and a CUDA implementations using an approach like in the article that @chemelnucfin quoted above.
Let's see if I'll have enough time to do it.
Failing that, I think that adding TensorFlow ops that use the naive implementation would still be useful.
